channel.title: Shutter Island
channel.description:
Just saw it and I thought it was great. The ending was amazing.
Basically about a marshall (played by Leonardo Dicaprio) who goes into an island - used as a ward to develop psychological treatments on people who have been diagnosed with insanity - after a patient has escaped. Upon the realization that there is something fishy going on, he goes into extreme depths to find out what is truly taking place on the island. During an encounter with a fugitive ex-employee of the facility, he is told that the occurrences that are truly taking place on the island are illegal and potentially fatal neuronic experiments with the patients and he is told that they will use a prior tragedy that had recently befell him (the murder of his wife) as a supplementary factor to declare him insane, thus issuing his permanent steady on the island.
I won't continue the synopsis since the end is truly great and not worth spoiling.
Anyone else seen it?

item.title: Shutter Island
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

Call me weird but I only just saw this movie. “To live as a monster? Or to die as a good man?”. In the end he chooses to get lobo w/e so that he wouldn’t have to live knowing what he did to his wife. What was the bandage on Andrews head there for? Was he already lobo w/e’d on already? Was the lady in the cave and the man in the cell all illusions in his head? I noticed that everything telling him that the operation there was evil seemed to be more unrealistic. I can tell this movie is gonna keep me thinking before I finally fall asleep.

Read full topic

@jme wrote:

This movie was a bad choice to watch, while coming down from speed. I felt insane to begin with.

Pretty interesting though. It seemed to drag on forever. But over all the movie had me thinking about it long after it was over.

item.title: Shutter Island
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

By the way, after discussing the movie with a friend, he actually told me that the movie, just as the book it was based on, was written in a way so that the reader/viewer could interpret what had actually elapsed in two different ways.

The first one, being the one most people picked up on (including myself), was that he actually was always crazy. The second one is the fact that he wasn’t crazy and it was all a setup in order so he would stay and they could continue their surgical experiments.

I also found additional sources giving proof to this:
http://www.associatedcontent.com/article/2722459/shutter_island_ending_results_in_many.html

Cheap Ass Gamer

Shutter Island - Spoilers out on the table - Lifestyle & Off Topic

Page 1 of 2 - Shutter Island - Spoilers out on the table - posted in Lifestyle & Off Topic: Don't cry about spoilers in this thread. I watched Shutter Island on Saturday and some people (mykevermin) are hating on it by calling it...

I actually watched it again just to confirm this thought and it’s pretty much true. Any scene can be interpreted with those two different perspectives.

Pretty cool.

Read full topic

For the record, I saw this a few nights ago and also found it quite enjoyable. Yeah, it was a bit of a mindfuck, but that’s the point. For the record, that line that abraham picked up on was lost on me until the second time I watched it, because the first time around I didn’t finish until about 2am.[/quote]

I got the line straight away, best part of the film imo

item.title: Shutter Island
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

Just saw this movie and I loved it. It was so psychologically intense, at some stages I felt like him. I didn’t want to believe what actually did happen.

[quote=“abraham2119, post:6, topic:331122”][quote author=Kane. link=topic=427489.msg3141512#msg3141512 date=1267581381]
Watched it last night… really fucked up movie.
But in saying that, It’s amazing.

It’s one of those movies that you get involved with as the main character.
During the plot twist you are also trying to accept reality, and are just as confused.
It gets in your head, which heightens the experience.

To be honest though I was kind of bored during most of it, but the ending was worth waiting for.
[/quote]Yes, I agree. His final line was gold.

“Better to die as a good man than to live as a monster”.

I had to analyze that line for about three minutes before actually figuring out what had happened. He was figuratively alluding to the fact that the treatment HAD worked and despite the fact that he did remember everything, he preferred to stay living within his delusion.[/quote]
I didn’t really pick out the relevance of his last line, but now that you mentioned it I only loved this movie more. I have yet to see a shit movie with Leonardo DiCaprio in it.

Read full topic

item.title: Shutter Island
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“abraham2119, post:6, topic:331122”][quote author=Kane. link=topic=427489.msg3141512#msg3141512 date=1267581381]
Watched it last night… really fucked up movie.
But in saying that, It’s amazing.

It’s one of those movies that you get involved with as the main character.
During the plot twist you are also trying to accept reality, and are just as confused.
It gets in your head, which heightens the experience.

To be honest though I was kind of bored during most of it, but the ending was worth waiting for.
[/quote]Yes, I agree. His final line was gold.

“Better to die as a good man than to live as a monster”.

I had to analyze that line for about three minutes before actually figuring out what had happened. He was figuratively alluding to the fact that the treatment HAD worked and despite the fact that he did remember everything, he preferred to stay living within his delusion.[/quote]
It was all so clever. The anagrams, the multiple personalities and their story/reason for existance. Really well thought out.

Read full topic
